Package xxl.core.util

This package provides miscellaneous utility classes that don't belong strictly to an other xxl-package.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Classifiable Objects implementing this interface can be classified.
Decorator<T> A marker interface for decorators additionally providing a method that returns the decorated objects (decoree).
Distance<T> An interface for determining the distance between two objects (see also Comparable <--> Comparator).
DistanceTo<T> An interface for determining the distance between two objects (see also Comparable <--> Comparator).
 

Class Summary
ArrayResizer The ArrayResizer provides methods that allow to modify the size of a given array after its construction.
Arrays The class Arrays contains methods which are concerned with arrays of primitive Java types.
BitSet This class is a replacement for java.util.BitSet which neither implements the interfaces Convertable nor Comparable.
DatabaseAccess This class contains all neccessary information to connect to a database.
DoubleArrays Static methods for dealing with double[] as numerical vectors.
Interval1D Class to implement one-dimensional intervals of any ordered data type.
IntervalND Class to implement multi-dimensional intervals based on n intervals of class Interval1D.
LongIdGenerator Handles identifyers which can be used for a lot of reasons.
ObjectPool<E> An object pool allows the reuse of unneeded objects by storing them in a pool.
Signature  
SignatureFactory  
Strings This class provides some useful methods for dealing with Strings and parsing Strings.
XXLSystem The XXLSystem class contains system related methods.
XXLSystem.Wrapper This class is a Wrapper for objects with the intention to distinguish two objects if and only if they refer to the same object.
 

Exception Summary
WrappingRuntimeException This Exception is useful for wrapping arbitrary Exceptions.
 

Package xxl.core.util Description

This package provides miscellaneous utility classes that don't belong strictly to an other xxl-package. It contains classes to create and work with one- or multidimensional intervals and tuples or even bit sets, a class to work dynamically with arrays and a class delivering a new RuntimeException thats wraps arbitary exceptions.
